titles.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that the Senate of each new Congress is not bound by the Rules of previous Senates.
A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that the Senate of each new Congress is not bound by the Rules of previous Senates.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.
Committee on Rules and Administration. Hearings held.

bill.summary: Declares that the Senate of each new Congress is not bound by the rules of previous Senates and should, upon a motion by a Senator to bring debate to a close, if said motion receives the affirmative vote of a majority of the Senators, proceed to determine the Rules of its Proceedings in accordance with the Constitution.
